Articles.Title: Long-Term Performance of an Image-Based Short-Term Risk Model for Breast Cancer
Prediction outcome: Diagnosis of breast cancer within 1-10 years
Symptomatic cancers within the first 3 years
Articles.Model Architecture: AI-based model using mammographic features combined with Tyrer-Cuzick v8 model

Datasets.Name: Karolinska Mammography Project for Risk Prediction of Breast Cancer (KARMA)
Datasets.Size: 8604 women, with 2028 incident breast cancers identified
Datasets.Cohort: Initiated in 2010 in Sweden for women age 40-74 years

Articles.Description: This study assesses the long-term performance of an AI-based, image-derived short-term risk model for breast cancer, comparing it to traditional risk models over a 10-year period.

Articles.Title: Machine learning-based lifetime breast cancer risk reclassification compared with the BOADICEA model: impact on screening recommendations
Prediction outcome: Lifetime breast cancer risk classification
Mammography surveillance recommendations based on risk
Articles.Evaluation Metrics: Area Under the Receiver Operating Characteristic (AU-ROC)
Articles.Model Architecture: Machine Learning algorithms including Markov Chain Monte Carlo Generalised Linear Mixed Model (MCMC GLMM), Adaptive Boosting (ADA), and Random Forest (RF)

Datasets.Name: Geneva University Hospitals Oncogenetic Unit database
Datasets.Cohort: Swiss

Articles.Description: This study compares ML algorithms against the BOADICEA model for predicting lifetime breast cancer risk, demonstrating the impact of ML-based reclassification on mammography screening recommendations.

Articles.Title: Prediction of lung adenocarcinoma prognosis and diagnosis with a novel model anchored in circadian clock-related genes
Prediction outcome: Overall survival times prediction
Articles.Model Architecture: Risk score model using Lasso regression and Cox proportional hazards model based on circadian clock-related genes

Datasets.Name: TCGA-LUAD
Datasets.Cohort: Patients with lung adenocarcinoma

Datasets.Name: GSE31210
Datasets.Cohort: Patients with lung adenocarcinoma for external validation

Datasets.Name: GSE68465
Datasets.Cohort: Patients with lung adenocarcinoma for external validation

Articles.Description: This study develops a risk score model for lung adenocarcinoma prognosis based on circadian clock-related genes, demonstrating high accuracy and potential for enhancing clinical decision-making.

Articles.Title: Identifying Risk Stratification Associated With a Cancer for Overall Survival by Deep Learning-Based CoxPH
Task: Risk stratification for overall survival in cancer
Prediction outcome: Ten-year overall survival in breast cancer
Articles.Model Architecture: DeepCoxPH model combining deep learning with Cox proportional hazards model

Datasets.Name: Taiwan Breast Cancer Consortium database
Datasets.Cohort: Patients diagnosed with breast cancer

Articles.Description: This study introduces DeepCoxPH, a novel method combining deep learning with traditional CoxPH analysis to improve risk stratification for overall survival in breast cancer.

Articles.Title: Toward robust mammography-based models for breast cancer risk
Prediction outcome: Risk of developing breast cancer within 5 years
Evaluation Metrics: Area Under the Receiver Operating Characteristic Curve (AUC)
Articles.Model Architecture: Mirai model, a deep learning-based architecture integrating mammographic views with risk factor prediction and an additive-hazard layer

Datasets.Name: Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH)
Datasets.Cohort: Diverse population, including multiple racial and age groups

Datasets.Name: Karolinska University Hospital
Datasets.Cohort: Swedish women, various age groups

Datasets.Name: Chang Gung Memorial Hospital (CGMH)
Datasets.Cohort: Taiwanese women, various age groups

Articles.Description: This study introduces the Mirai model, which predicts breast cancer risk across multiple populations and demonstrates superior performance over traditional and previous deep learning models.

Articles.Title: A Multi-scale CNN and Curriculum Learning Strategy for Mammogram Classification
Prediction outcome: Diagnosis of breast cancer presence
Evaluation Metrics: Area Under the Receiver Operating Characteristic Curve (AUROC)
Articles.Model Architecture: Multi-scale Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) trained with a curriculum learning strategy, using patch-level classifiers as feature extractors for a full-image model

Datasets.Name: Digital Database for Screening Mammography (DDSM)
Datasets.Cohort: Patients undergoing screening mammography

Articles.Description: This study presents a multi-scale CNN architecture combined with a curriculum learning strategy to improve the accuracy of mammogram classification.

Articles.Title: deepDR: a network-based deep learning approach to in silico drug repositioning
Prediction outcome: Identification of new drug uses
Evaluation Metrics: Area Under the Receiver Operating Characteristic Curve (AUROC)
Articles.Model Architecture: Multi-modal deep autoencoder (MDA) combined with a collective variational autoencoder (cVAE) for integrating and encoding drug information from multiple networks

Datasets.Name: DrugBank, repoDB, ClinicalTrials.gov
Datasets.Size: 6677 clinically reported drug-disease pairs involving 1519 drugs and 1229 diseases
Datasets.Cohort: Drugs and diseases from diverse clinical reports

Articles.Description: This study presents deepDR, a network-based deep learning method for predicting new drug uses by integrating multiple types of drug-related networks.

Articles.Title: An integrative deep learning framework for classifying molecular subtypes of breast cancer
Task: Classification of molecular subtypes of breast cancer
Prediction outcome: Molecular subtype classification (e.g., Luminal A, Luminal B, HER-2 enriched, Basal-like)
Evaluation Metrics: Area Under the Receiver Operating Characteristic Curve (AUROC)
Articles.Model Architecture: Integrative Deep Neural Network that combines copy number alterations and gene expression data using concatenation layers

Datasets.Name: METABRIC (Molecular Taxonomy of Breast Cancer International Consortium)
Datasets.Cohort: Clinically annotated primary breast cancer specimens from North American and European tumor banks

Articles.Description: This study proposes an integrative deep learning model for classifying molecular subtypes of breast cancer, enhancing predictive accuracy by combining genomic and transcriptomic data.

Articles.Title: Harnessing multimodal data integration to advance precision oncology
Prediction outcome: Risk of relapse
Treatment failure
Articles.Model Architecture: Artificial intelligence methods integrating multimodal data

Datasets.Name: Not specified in provided text
Datasets.Cohort: Patients undergoing cancer treatment

Articles.Description: This paper discusses the potential of integrating multimodal data in precision oncology, focusing on overcoming data sparsity and the challenges of training AI with current medical datasets.

Articles.Title: Multimodal data integration using machine learning improves risk stratification of high-grade serous ovarian cancer
Task: Risk stratification for high-grade serous ovarian cancer
Prediction outcome: Prognosis of overall survival
Time to recurrence
Evaluation Metrics: Area Under the Receiver Operating Characteristic Curve (AUROC)
Articles.Model Architecture: Integrative machine learning model combining features from histopathology, radiology, and clinicogenomic data

Datasets.Name: Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center cohort
Datasets.Cohort: Patients with primarily late-stage high-grade serous ovarian cancer

Articles.Description: This study enhances risk stratification in ovarian cancer by integrating histopathological, radiological, and clinicogenomic data using advanced machine learning techniques.

Articles.Title: Deep learning-based multimodal spatial transcriptomics analysis for cancer
Prediction outcome: Identifying tumor heterogeneity
Optimizing radiotherapy
Integrating MRI data with genomic profiles for glioma grading
Combining proteomic and clinical data to uncover drug resistance mechanisms
Articles.Model Architecture: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for image classification, segmentation, and tumor volume analysis

Datasets.Name: Not specified
Datasets.Cohort: Cancer patients

Articles.Description: This chapter explores the integration of deep learning with multimodal spatial transcriptomics to advance cancer diagnostics, treatment planning, and precision medicine.

Articles.Title: Multimodal MRI Deep Learning for Predicting Central Lymph Node Metastasis in Papillary Thyroid Cancer
Task: Prediction of central lymph node metastasis in papillary thyroid cancer
Prediction outcome: Identifying patients at risk of central lymph node metastasis
Articles.Model Architecture: Attention mechanism-based multimodal classification network (AMMCNet) integrating MRI images and clinicopathological data

Datasets.Name: Dataset from a hospital
Datasets.Cohort: Patients diagnosed with papillary thyroid cancer

Articles.Description: This study develops a deep learning model using multimodal MRI data and clinicopathological information to predict central lymph node metastasis in patients with papillary thyroid cancer.

Articles.Title: Non-invasive multimodal CT deep learning biomarker to predict pathological complete response of non-small cell lung cancer following neoadjuvant immunochemotherapy: a multicenter study
Task: Prediction of pathological complete response in non-small cell lung cancer
Prediction outcome: Pathological complete response following neoadjuvant immunochemotherapy
Evaluation Metrics: Area under the receiver operating characteristic curve (AUC)
Articles.Model Architecture: Multimodal deep learning models including LUNAI-uCT, LUNAI-eCT, and LUNAI-fCT for feature extraction from CT scans

Datasets.Name: Multicenter clinical data
Datasets.Cohort: Patients with NSCLC undergoing neoadjuvant immunochemotherapy

Articles.Description: This study developed and validated a deep learning-based multimodal CT biomarker that non-invasively predicts pathological complete response in NSCLC patients undergoing neoadjuvant immunochemotherapy, using a multicenter dataset.

Articles.Title: Long-term cancer survival prediction using multimodal deep learning
Prediction outcome: Conditional survival probabilities for follow-up time intervals spanning several decades
Articles.Model Architecture: MultiSurv, a multimodal deep learning method with dedicated submodels for each data modality, a data fusion layer, and a prediction submodel for generating survival probabilities

Datasets.Name: Data from 33 different cancer types
Datasets.Size: Comprehensive dataset encompassing multiple data modalities
Datasets.Cohort: Pan-cancer patients
Datasets.Publicly Available: Yes, sourced from the National Cancer Instituteâ€™s Genomic Data Commons

Articles.Description: This study introduces MultiSurv, a multimodal deep learning approach for predicting long-term survival across multiple cancer types, capable of handling high-dimensional and missing data.

Articles.Title: A Machine Learning Model Based on PET/CT Radiomics and Clinical Characteristics Predicts Tumor Immune Profiles in Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer: A Retrospective Multicohort Study
Task: Predicting tumor immune profiles in non-small cell lung cancer
Prediction outcome: CD8 expression in tumors
Articles.Model Architecture: Machine learning models integrating PET/CT radiomics and clinical data

Datasets.Name: TCGA, Daping Hospital, TCIA
Datasets.Size: 1145 from TCGA, 221 from Daping Hospital, 39 from TCIA
Datasets.Cohort: Non-small cell lung cancer patients

Articles.Description: This study uses PET/CT radiomics combined with clinical data to predict immune profiles, particularly CD8 expression in non-small cell lung cancer, using a machine learning approach.

Articles.Title: Multimodal deep learning models for the prediction of pathologic response to neoadjuvant chemotherapy in breast cancer
Task: Prediction of pathologic response to neoadjuvant chemotherapy in breast cancer
Prediction outcome: Pathologic complete response (pCR)
Articles.Model Architecture: Deep learning model combining ResNet-50 with 3D CNNs for MR images and fully connected layers for clinical information

Datasets.Name: Samsung Medical Center
Datasets.Cohort: Patients with invasive breast cancer undergoing neoadjuvant chemotherapy

Articles.Description: This study developed a multimodal deep learning model that integrates MR images and clinical data to predict the pathologic response to neoadjuvant chemotherapy in breast cancer patients.

Articles.Title: In-context learning enables multimodal large language models to classify cancer pathology images
Task: Classification of tissue subtypes in colorectal cancer
Breast tumor detection in lymph node sections
Prediction outcome: Classification of different cancer tissue types
Evaluation Metrics: Area Under the Receiver Operating Characteristic Curve (AUROC)
Articles.Model Architecture: Generative Pretrained Transformer 4 with Vision capabilities (GPT-4V) utilizing in-context learning

Datasets.Name: Three cancer histopathology benchmarking datasets
Datasets.Cohort: Colorectal cancer, colon polyps, breast tumor lymph node sections

Articles.Description: This study evaluates the use of GPT-4V in medical image analysis for classifying cancer pathology images using in-context learning, demonstrating potential to match or exceed specialized neural networks.
